clinical_history: Pelvic pain with suspected ovarian pathology.
technique: High-resolution linear and curvilinear probes used for detailed evaluation.
findings: Gallbladder shows isoechoic, no stones or wall thickening.
Left kidney shows enlarged, corticomedullary differentiation preserved.
Breast tissue shows coarse lesion measuring 17.25 mm.
Common bile duct measures 35.35 mm, within normal limits.
Soft tissue region demonstrates isoechoic without fluid collection.
recommendations: MRI or CT correlation may be helpful.
